result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael E Hobbs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Reckless Homicide, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.06(1).
  • Hit and Run-Involve Death, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).
  • 2nd Degree Reckless Homicide, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.06(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
$25,475.56 to be paid first, before costs, fees and surcharges.   To be paid in following order:  $9,121.00 to Brian F. to be paid first; secondly $10,490.66 to James F.; thirdly $2,863.90 to Trevor H.; and $3,000.00 to Jeremy O. to be paid fourth.
*** 7-23-2015, Judge Rothstein; Court ordered restitution order entered on 7/17/15 be modified as follows:
- $13,490.66 to Jeremy O.
- $0 to James F.***

Pay DNA surcharge on counts one and two. Court waived DNA surcharge on count three because it is concurrent to count one.
AS TO EACH COUNT, ONE, TWO AND THREE:  Court costs, fees, surcharges and restitution to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Consecutive to count two, concurrent with count three.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain HSED/GED.  Participate in vocational training or further educational programming.

No contact with Jeremy O., Tonya H., Paul H., Brian F. or any member of the victim's family.
No contact with the following people associated with this offense Damian W., Julian M., Joel S., Mercedes Z., Naila C., Deandre A., Nelson L. an dKiara P.
No contact with any gangs including the Cuthroat Gang.

Participate in counseling and cognitive thinking therapy.
For the first 10 years of Extended Supervision to spend 20 hours per year speaking to high school students or drivers ed classes.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are  restored
Consecutive to: Consecutive to counts one and three. Credit for 145 days.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to count two, concurent with count one.

records.addlTxt: Per Remittitur dated February 13, 2019, Appeal No. 2016AP001187 CRNM,  IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDGED by this court in a decision filed on September 19, 2018, that:  IT IS ORDERED that the amended judgment of conviction and postconviction order are summarily affirmed.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.21.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Mark Schoenfeldt  is relieved of further representation of Michael Hobbs in this matter.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.32(3).
records.descr: Remittitur/Court of Appeals dec & order affirming

Per order dated Setember 19, 2018, Appeal No. 2016AP1187-CRNM, IT IS ORDERED that the amended judgment of conviction and postconviction order are summarily affirmed.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.21.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Mark Schoenfeldt is relieved from further representing Michael Hobbs  in this matter.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.32(3).  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this summary disposition order will not be published.

Order to Seal signed and filed. It is ordered that the Clerk of Court accept for filing under seal the submissions made by the State for a period of 90 days from today. Submission marked as Exhibit 1. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Motion to Seal submitted by ADA Apollo with attached proposed order received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Letters on behalf of the defendant received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
As to COUNTS 4 & 5- Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS 4 & 5 dismissed but read in for purposes of sentencing.

Defendant Michael E Hobbs in court with attorney Joshua Davis Uller.  Defendant Michael E Hobbs in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. Sidebar placed on the record. Discussion regarding the State's filing on 7/16/15. State placed negotiations on the record. Plea hearing proceeded.
Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNTS 1, 2, & 3:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgments of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.
Private Presentence Investigation report submitted by Attorney Uller received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
DVD submitted by the State received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Victim Impact Statements with attached restitution information received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
